decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to use the combination of Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to quickly mill your library, enabling cards like Dread Return and Thassa's Oracle to win the game instantly. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and removal spells such as Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo. Cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help to dig for key pieces, while Urza's Saga provides additional value. The deck aims to assemble its combo quickly while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly casting a large number of spells to combo off and win the game in a single turn. It utilizes creatures like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to mill the entire library, then uses Thassa's Oracle or Pact of Negation to secure the win. The deck includes a number of fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide, as well as disruptive spells like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize to protect the combo. The goal is to execute the combo as quickly and efficiently as possible to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It utilizes cards like Daze, Thoughtseize, and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's strategy while deploying threats like Brazen Borrower, Murktide Regent, and Nethergoyf to close out the game quickly. The deck also includes efficient removal like Fatal Push and versatile card selection with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive game plan with plenty of color fixing and disruption in the form of Wasteland.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing lands as a resource. By using cards like Life from the Loam, Exploration, and Crop Rotation, the deck can consistently access powerful lands like The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale and Dark Depths. This allows the deck to disrupt opponents' strategies while creating a strong board presence. The goal is to outvalue the opponent through efficient land usage and strategic plays, ultimately leading to victory through attrition and overwhelming board presence.

The deck focuses on assembling a quick and explosive combo to win the game in a single turn. By casting a series of low-cost spells and utilizing creatures that can be sacrificed for additional benefit, the goal is to quickly empty the library and win the game with cards such as Dread Return or Thassa's Oracle. The deck includes a lot of acceleration and protection spells to ensure the combo can be executed as efficiently as possible before the opponent has a chance to respond.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Thassa's Oracle and Paradigm Shift in order to win the game by decking yourself out. It includes cards that provide card selection and protection, as well as mana acceleration to help speed up the combo. The deck also aims to disrupt opponents with cards like Chalice of the Void and Force of Will. The key strategy is to efficiently set up the win condition while controlling the game and preventing opponents from interfering with the combo.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disruption, removal, and card advantage to control the game and outvalue the opponent. It utilizes hand disruption with cards like Thoughtseize, removal spells like Fatal Push, and counterspells like Force of Will to keep the opponent off balance. The deck also includes card selection with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure it finds the right answers at the right time. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides additional card advantage, while Thundertrap Trainer and Orcish Bowmasters offer creature control. Overall, the deck aims to control the board and outplay the opponent through superior card advantage and powerful threats.
